200.name: OK
200.explanation: The request has succeeded. The client can read the result of the request in the body and the headers of the response.

201.name: Created
201.explanation: The request has been fulfilled and resulted in a new resource being created.

202.name: Accepted
202.explanation: The request has been accepted for processing, but the processing has not been completed.

204.name: No Content
204.explanation: The request has succeeded but returns no message body.

400.name: Bad Request
400.explanation: The request could not be understood by the server due to malformed syntax. The message body will contain more information; see Response Schema.

401.name: Unauthorized
401.explanation: The request requires user authentication or, if the request included authorization credentials, authorization has been refused for those credentials.

403.name: Forbidden
403.explanation: The server understood the request, but is refusing to fulfill it.

404.name: Not Found
404.explanation: The requested resource could not be found. This error can be due to a temporary or permanent condition.

500.name:
Internal Server Error. You should never receive this error because our (Spotify's) clever coders catch them all ... but if you are unlucky enough to get one, please report it to us (Spotify) through either:
Customer Service: https://support.spotify.com/contact-spotify-support/
Community Forum: https://developer.spotify.com/community
500.explanation:
One reason can be caused by endpoint '/v1/users/{user_id}/playlists/': There are cases where a user's list of playlists (or an individual playlist) cause temporary issues in Spotify's backend.
https://stackoverflow.com/a/30661233

502.name: Bad Gateway
502.explanation: The server was acting as a gateway or proxy and received an invalid response from the upstream server.

503.name: Service Unavailable
503.explanation: The server is currently unable to handle the request due to a temporary condition which will be alleviated after some delay. You can choose to resend the request again.
